SENT.plain: INTRODUCTION: Foreign accent syndrome (FAS) is an unusual neurological speech disorder documented in not more than twenty specific studies
As a consequence of a cerebral mainly subcortical injury, the patient s speech is foreign sounding to native listeners
As subject cannot avoid this foreign accent, and given its abrupt emergence, this disorder usually involves emotional consequences by loss of identity and of belonging to a speech community
CASE REPORT: In this paper, a case from Castell√≥n de la Plana (Spain) is presented with a injury in right basal ganglia and the literature about this topic is revised
CONCLUSIONS: From the available data, we describe the main characteristics of the syndrome and discuss the possible role of basal ganglia
